definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: On hearing that, her face went white to the lips.
sentences.chinese: 一听那话她脸色登时变得苍白，直白到嘴唇了。

sentences.english: However, when the revellers saw the nun, the room went dead silent.
sentences.chinese: 那些人见到修女进来，整个场所登时变得死寂。

sentences.english: Actually, we live in a modern period.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们生活在一个摩登时代。

sentences.english: Of them have been selected to exhibit at Pingyao with lots of attention and disputation .
sentences.chinese: 他挑出其中九张在平遥展出，登时引起关注和争议。

sentences.english: If my heart had been an iron boiler it would have burst.
sentences.chinese: 假如我的心房是一口锅炉的话，登时就炸啦。

sentences.english: City Lights and Modern Times were of this kind.
sentences.chinese: “城市之光”和“摩登时代”就是这种影片。

sentences.english: I see no objection whconsumedver-but you should open the L/C right now.
sentences.chinese: 我看没有什么可抗议的，不过您该当登时开证。

sentences.english: Modern Time by Chaplin is a silent film.
sentences.chinese: 卓别林演的《摩登时代》是一部无声影片。

sentences.english: It gave him such a shock that his face turned white .
sentences.chinese: 那使他大为震惊，登时脸都白了。

sentences.english: Regarding John I will write to him simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 至于约翰我将登时给他写信。

sentences.english: Trinket's elation quickly vanished and he went off disconsolately to change back into his eunuch's uniform.
sentences.chinese: 韦小宝登时意兴索然，便去换了小太监的服色。

sentences.english: Yada sherry interpret the modern era , life and language .
sentences.chinese: 来自雅达敏敏演绎了摩登时代，生活，语言。

sentences.english: Post-modernism moves away from the rational culture of the so-called “modern era.”
sentences.chinese: 后现代主义跳出了所谓“摩登时代”的理性文化。

definition: in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
to have heard what was said
